instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Got the board after water, more info from this post [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>-at-4v.59468/#post-60661[/URL]

It is working fine, but there is no sound, i got I/O board from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and native one from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, when connect either of them to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> both works fine/audio present.
If connect both to <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, either have no sound. 

Any idea?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Missing headphone sound too?
Audio codec recognized in System Report?
Inspect J9500 pins for corrosion; HDA related...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
audio codec is not recognised
headphone sound missing
j9500 pins are all soldered fine, no water near.

J9500 diode mode readings:
Pin47 0.465
Pin45 0.460
Pin43 0.413
Pin39 0.464

On donor board i am getting at Pin39 0.570

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Compare all diode mode readings for HDA lines with working board.
3437 should have similar readings, I suppose.

Check if caps/resistors exist on these lines.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Check if caps/resistors exist on these lines.
[/QUOTE]

I checked all components and lines, all intact.

<SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1313</RESISTOR> 33ohm
<SIGNAL>HDA_SDOUT_R</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1921</RESISTOR> 1kohm
<SIGNAL>HDA_SYNC</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1311</RESISTOR> 33ohm
<SIGNAL>HDA_BIT_CLK</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R1310</RESISTOR> 33ohm

J9500 diode mode readings:
Not working sound board:00165-a
Pin47 0.465
Pin45 0.460
Pin43 0.413
Pin39 0.464
Working sound board:3437-b
Pin47 0.505
Pin45 0.502
Pin43 0.455
Pin39 0.504

Can this tiny difference cause that issue?
Also i do not have 00165-a known good I/O board to check, only from 3437-b, is there a difference?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
00165 board works with LIO from 3437 for sure; tested few days ago.
Probably viceversa valid too.

Not critical differences on the measurments...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message: any ideas?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Check first for corrosion on the MLB.
Probably someting more affected.

You may need to change LIO connector, J9500...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
originally, corrosion was around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
I cleaned it all, is there something around SMC that is sound related, that i could have missed?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Is <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> high?

Check the 4 resistors <RESISTOR>R1310</RESISTOR>-13.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
I changed J9500, no luck.
i cannot measure <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> when board is inside the housing, but when it is out it is 0v.
<RESISTOR>R1310</RESISTOR> 33ohm
<RESISTOR>R1311</RESISTOR> 33ohm
<RESISTOR>R1312</RESISTOR> 33ohm
<RESISTOR>R1313</RESISTOR> 33ohm

Noticed that outside the housing fan spins at max rpm, with one I/O board it is gradually starting to increase speed till maxes out, with other one it is straight away max speed, when place back in housing fan spins normally. Should it be like that?
I saw before how no sound issue appears if I/O board is faulty, fans spins at max and slow operating ( one of the sensors that is there does not read) 
Could it be related?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Hi Flopper I have the same problem as you and i'm following this thread to see if infomaticos can find a solution. Just to let you know that outside of the housing the fan will spin on full. It's normally to do with it not seeing the trackpad. So don't worry about that.

My 2 cents worth says that there's a problem with the PCH not sending out the signals to the audio controller but I could be wrong.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message: Hi Kappy! I was afraid that it might be cpu itself as there is no more things to check.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> must be high.
Check it with both MLB and LIO board connected, out of the chassis.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message: <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL>  is 0v out of the chassis when fan spins at max.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
Fan max spins is caused by missing trackpad, normal issue out of chassis.
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> is not good, that's the reason of missing audio.
Check on the good board if is high only when LIO board connected, or even without LIO flex.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message: customer collected yesterday 3437-b. Will have to find board to check, will let you know.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
i found one more 3437-b. 
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 1.49v with LIO Connected with flex.
without flex <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 0v on working board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message: So the first board could still have a bad connection over LIO flex/connector.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
i have tried 3 different Flex/LIO boards.
Replaced J9500
All HDA Pins reads ok, diode mode close to working board.
all i have left is to "just in case" replace all resistors on HDA lines and if thats not working thats mean its CPU?
Or hardwire 4 HDA lines from J9500 to Flex?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> is controlled by PCH/CPU.
As it stays low without LIO flex even on working board, that means PCH needs to detect something from LIO board to enable it.
So a small chance of bad connection.
But if you already discarded all connection problems, then bad PCH...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a No Sound
threads.message:
i hardwired J9500 4 HDA lines to LIO board to rule out bad connection for sure, did not worked.
So it will be no fix.
Thanks for your input anyway.
